result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice from Sheriff's Dept - Protective Order Served
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on October 25th, 2022.
Notice Regarding United States Passport For Criminal Defendant
Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim * listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.

Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim * listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.
The original document was titled: Proposed Protective Order
The original history event date is: 10-24-2022
Preliminary hearing on November 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Marcos L Gallegos
Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W. Moreland Boulevard, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 10-24-2022)
Prior: 1236 S Grandview Blvd, Waukesha, WI 53188

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A/witnesses A-D listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victim A/Witnesses A-D, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent. Defendant to pay costs associated with GPS monitoring. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release. Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court. Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance,  duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action. Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A/Witnesses A-D listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.

3:18 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Marcos L Gallegos in court, in custody.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Marcos L Gallegos. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. 
The Defendant is now eligible for SPD representation.
PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS. 
The Court puts the Defendant on notice that if it receives a WCS non-compliance letter, that the Court will forfeit bail and issue a warrant.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
